text: Yeah, I was in the boy scouts at the time.
keypoint: Recalls being in the boy scouts

text: And we was doing the 50-yard dash, racing, but we was at the pier, marked off, and so we was doing the 50-yard dash.
keypoint: Describes doing the 50-yard dash at the pier

text: There was about 8 or 9 of us, you know, going down, coming back.
keypoint: Several boys race back and forth

text: And, going down the third time, I caught cramps and I started yelling "Help!",
keypoint: Gets cramps and calls for help

text: but the fellows didn't believe me, you know. They thought I was just trying to catch up, because I was going on or slowing down. So all of them kept going. They leave me.
keypoint: Friends think heâ€™s faking and leave him behind

text: And so I started going down.
keypoint: Begins to go under the water

text: Scoutmaster was up there. He was watching me. But he didn't pay me no attention either.
keypoint: Scoutmaster notices but ignores the situation

text: And for no reason at all there was another guy, who had just walked up that minute... He just jumped over and grabbed me.
keypoint: A stranger arrives and rescues him
